thread.title: Ajax 1 Legia Warsaw 0 (agg 1-0): Nick Viergever grabs his second goal in two years to send Dutch giants through
thread.title_full: Ajax 1 Legia Warsaw 0 (agg 1-0): Nick Viergever grabs his second goal in two years to send Dutch giants through

author: rforrester
title: Ajax 1 Legia Warsaw 0 (agg 1-0): Nick Viergever grabs his second goal in two years to send Dutch giants through
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FOUR-time European Champions Ajax edged their way into the last 16 of the Europa League thanks to a rare goal from Nick Viergever. 
After 138 minutes of action, the deadlock was eventually broken by the defender who bagged just his second goal in two years. AP:Associated Press 6 Nick Viergever was in the right place at the right time to open the scoring 
The game needed a moment of magic and after some scintillating passing, the ball found Davy Klaassen in the box who laid it into the path of Hakim Ziyech. 
His first time effort was beaten away by the keeper but right into the path of Viergever to poke home three minutes into the second-half. Getty Images 6 Ajax celebrate after finally breaking the deadlock three minutes into the second half 
Following a 0-0 draw in the first-leg, Ajax dominated the early possession but had to wait until the 19th minute to create their first clear-cut opportunity. 
And they were so unlucky not to break the deadlock. 
Following some good work down the left flank by Amin Younes, the forward squared the ball to the talented Ziyech whose effort hit off the post with the keeper beaten. 
Kasper Dolberg should have pounced on the rebound but was caught on his heels. Reuters Ajax goalkeeper Andre Onana couldn’t resist getting in on the celebrations Related articles EUROPA DRAW Manchester United await their fate for Europa League last 16 draw - Schalke, Ajax, Roma in the hat Europa League round-up Lyon thrash AZ Alkmaar 7-1 while a Pope-inspired Villarreal beat Roma 1-0... but lose on agg in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? Man Utd are the only English team left - all you need to know Brand new striker Eric has a shock in store for Nick over the latest blackmail scandal NEIL CUSTIS Wayne Rooney may have turned down China move but his Man United days are numbered... and the statement told you something was up Willy or won't he? Willy Caballero insists he will not rush new Manchester City deal despite being club's No1 keeper STAN-D AND DELIVER Time is sadly running out to organise a salute to Queens Park Rangers legend and Alzheimer's sufferer Stan Bowles 'We were stupid' Christian Eriksen blasts Spurs' display against Gent despite Mauricio Pochettino saying he's 'proud' Bon appetit Man City and Chelsea on red alert after £50m-rated Leonardo Bonucci falls out with Juventus boss Max Allegri SNARLING FOXES Sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri is furious after being 'betrayed by players and board' Neil Ashton Leicester flops who cost Claudio Ranieri his job deserve to lose their Prem title medals LUIZ IS STILL IN KNEE-D David Luiz needs treatment for rest of season following Sergio Aguero horror tackle in November AP:Associated Press 6 Legia fans arrived in Amsterdam in their droves and created a stunning atmosphere in the ground 
Two minutes later and another Younes cross from the left trickled across the six yard box with no bodies to tap home the simplest of finishes. 
The Polish champions were soaking up the pressure and came within inches of grabbing a vital away goal when Vadis Odjidja-Ofie couldn’t poke home Michal Kucharczyk’s cross five minutes before the first-half whistle. AP:Associated Press 6 Legia Warsaw came within inches of grabbing a first half away goal 
It was a stark warning for the Dutch giants who were up against a side that held Real Madrid to a thrilling 3-3 draw earlier in the campaign. 
But the home side only had to wait three minutes in the second period to break the deadlock through Viergever as a huge sigh of relief swept around the stadium. AP:Associated Press 6 The away fans tried to encourage their side but to no avail 
It forced the visitors come come out fighting but Legia were seriously lacking creativity in the final third. 
And it was Ajax who came closest to grabbing the second when Lasse Schone’s strike whistled past the post. Watch CCTV of the moment Legia Warsaw fans attack a bar full of Ajax fans in Poland
